=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Sound of Music 50th Anniversary [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2016/06/03 Store: Julie Andrews (Actor), Christopher Plummer (Actor), Robert Wise (Director) & 0 more Rated: G Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Blu-ray Disc 1:', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 Feature Film Remastered in 1080p Hi-Def with 7.1 DTS-HD Sound', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 Your Favorite Things: An Interactive Celebration — All-New Immersive Viewing Experience with Behind-the-Scenes Images, On-Screen Lyrics, Trivia Track and Location Quiz', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 Music Machine Sing-Along', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 Audio Commentaries with Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Director Robert Wise', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Blu-ray Disc 2:', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 NEW hour-long documentary THE SOUND OF A CITY: JULIE ANDREWS RETURNS TO SALZBURG', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 NOTE: Digital subscription will work even if the codes are expired.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Musicals & Performing Arts/Musicals/General', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, Heather Menzies, Duane Chase, Robert Wise, Nicholas Hammond, Rodgers & Hammerstein, Charmian Carr, Eleanor Parker, Peggy Wood, Angela Cartwright, Richard HaydnJulie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, Heather Menzies, Duane Chase, Robert Wise, Nicholas Hammond, Rodgers & Hammerstein, Charmian Carr, Eleanor Parker, Peggy Wood, Angela Cartwright, Richard Haydn See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 56 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.5 x 5.3 x 6.7 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '24543029564', 'Director': 'Robert Wise', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 56 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 10, 2015', 'Actors': 'Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, Eleanor Parker, Richard Haydn, Peggy Wood', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English, French', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Happy Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Secret Garden (Hallmark Hall of Fame) Review Date: 2016/06/03 Store: Gennie James (Actor), Barret Oliver (Actor), Alan Grint (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family Product Description: ['Product description', "Well-loved TV adaptation of Frances Hodgson Burnett's novel.", 'Amazon.com', "Mary Lennox (Gennie James) is a spoiled young British girl orphaned by an Indian epidemic. She is sent to Misselthwaite Manor in Yorkshire to live with a distant relative, Archibald Craven (Derek Jacobi), and there she becomes obsessed with a secret, overgrown garden. With the help of a local boy, Dickon, the garden and everyone around them--including Craven and his frail son, Colin--come to life again. Filmed on location at scenic Highclere Castle in Newbury, this Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation of Frances Hodgson Burnett's classic won an Emmy for Outstanding Children's Program. Although it can't top the 1949 version with Margaret O'Brien (or Agnieszka Holland's 1993 version), younger viewers may prefer this more straightforward retelling, whereas adults are sure to appreciate the fine performances by Jacobi and Billie Whitelaw (Mrs. Medlock). Colin Firth (", "Bridget Jones's Diary", ') appears briefly as the adult Colin in this timeless, uplifting story for all ages.', '--Kathleen C. Fennessy'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Dolby, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Philip Locke, Alan Grint, Frances Hodgson Burnett, Colin Firth, Cassie Stuart, Barret Oliver, Karen Archer, Julian Glover, Billie Whitelaw, Jadrien Steele, Gennie James, Michael Hordern, Derek Jacobi, Lucy Gutteridge, Blanche HanalisPhilip Locke, Alan Grint, Frances Hodgson Burnett, Colin Firth, Cassie Stuart, Barret Oliver, Karen Archer, Julian Glover, Billie Whitelaw, Jadrien Steele, Gennie James, Michael Hordern, Derek Jacobi, Lucy Gutteridge, Blanche Hanalis See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Alan Grint', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 21, 2002', 'Actors': 'Gennie James, Barret Oliver, Jadrien Steele, Michael Hordern, Billie Whitelaw', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Hallmark', 'Writers': 'Blanche Hanalis, Frances Hodgson Burnett', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Happy Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Eat Pray Love (Theatrical and Extended Cut) [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2016/10/15 Store: Julia Roberts (Actor), James Franco (Actor), Ryan Murphy (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Liz Gilbert (Julia Roberts) is a modern woman on a quest to marvel at and travel the world while rediscovering and reconnecting with her true inner self in', 'Eat Pray Love', '. At a crossroads after a divorce, Gilbert takes a year-long sabbatical from her job and steps uncharacteristically out of her comfort zone, risking everything to change her life. In her wondrous and exotic travels, she experiences the simple pleasure of nourishment by eating in Italy; the power of prayer in India, and, finally and unexpectedly, the inner peace and balance of love in Bali. Based on an inspiring true story,', 'Eat Pray Love', 'proves that there really is more than one way to let yourself go and see the world.', 'Amazon.com', "Elizabeth Gilbert's memoir of enlightenment gets the deluxe treatment at the hands of", 'Glee', 'creator Ryan Murphy, who bathes every scene in a golden glow. Unaccustomed to being alone, Liz (Julia Roberts) exits her marriage to Stephen (Billy Crudup, quite good) only to enter into an affair with an actor (James Franco, curiously uncomfortable), who introduces her to meditation. Just as her editor, Delia (', 'Doubt', "'s Viola Davis, making the most of a small role), longed to have a baby, Liz has longed to see the world. Delia persuades her to seize the day (plus, money presents no obstacle). First, she travels to Italy, where she noshes from Rome to Naples, making new friends along the way. Then, she heads to an ashram in India, where she meets a bride-to-be and a remorseful man (Richard Jenkins, heartbreaking), who nurture her altruistic side. Her sojourn ends in Bali, where she reunites with Ketut (Hadi Subiyanto, hilarious), the healer who first encouraged her to reassess her situation. While there, she befriends a single mother and a single father (", 'No Country for Old Men', "'s Javier Bardem) who falls for her charms. In an improvement over his version of", 'Running with Scissors', ", Murphy combines two Oscar winners, two Oscar nominees, and four countries to follow one woman's path to fulfillment. Like", 'Julie and Julia', 'and', 'How Stella Got Her Groove Back', ", Liz's story becomes more involving as she lets go of the superficial, but Murphy's movie still represents a triumph of escapism over spirituality.", '--Kathleen C. Fennessy'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Romance', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Javier Bardem, Julia Roberts, Viola Davis, Richard Jenkins, Ryan Murphy, Billy Crudup, James Franco', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '4 hours and 45 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.51 x 5.43 x 6.8 inches; 5.92 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '15059349', 'Director': 'Ryan Murphy', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '4 hours and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 23, 2010', 'Actors': 'Julia Roberts, James Franco, Richard Jenkins, Viola Davis, Billy Crudup', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: No movie cover. Review Title: Three Stars Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Greater Review Date: 2017/01/05 Store: Neal McDonough (Actor), Quinton Aaron (Actor), David Hunt (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['Product Description', 'GREATER follows the true story of Brandon Burlsworth who is perhaps the greatest walk-on in the history of college football. Brandon dreamed of playing for the Arkansas Razorbacks but was told he wasn t good enough to play Division I ball. Undeterred, Brandon took a risk and walked on in 1994. Written off by fellow teammates and coaches, Brandon displayed dogged determination in the face of staggering odds. The awkward kid who once was an embarrassment to his teammates and an annoyance to his coaches ended up becoming the most respected player in the history of the program, changing the lives of all he touched.', 'Review', '"Burlsworth s story is undeniably touching"- --LA times"The best underdog sports movies since The Blind Side. It will make you stand up and cheer!" --NYC movie guru"Greater is a tremendous and inspiring film" --Dove'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '8 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 7.05 Ounces', 'Item model number': '43297414', 'Director': 'David Hunt', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, THX', 'Run time': '2 hours and 10 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 20, 2016', 'Actors': 'Neal McDonough, Quinton Aaron, Christopher Severio', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Well Go Usa', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Love it. Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Dolly Parton's Christmas of Many Colors: Circle of Love [DVD] Review Date: 2018/01/12 Store: Alyvia Alyn Lind (Actor), Jennifer Nettles (Actor), Stephen Herek (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary Product Description: ["Dolly Parton's Christmas of Many Colors: Circle of Love (DVD)", 'Coming off the phenomenal performance of last year’s holiday special and looking to recapture the enthusiasm of the nearly 16 million viewers who tuned in, the heartwarming story continues with the next chapter in the young life of legendary country singer Dolly Parton, Dolly Parton’s Christmas of Many Colors: Circle of Love. The film delivers Christmas joy and peril as an unexpected blizzard threatens the Parton family, while at the same time Dolly’s father (and his kids) make sacrifices to raise enough money to finally buy his loving wife the wedding ring he could never afford to give her. Meanwhile, an important person in little Dolly’s life begins to see that her amazing voice and musical gift might just be made for something bigger than rural Tennessee.', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Documentary, Musicals, Arts, Culture & Entertainment', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, DVD', 'Contributor': 'Alyvia Alyn Lind, Ricky Schroder, Sam Haskell, Gerald McRaney, Hudson Hickman, Stephen Herek, Jennifer Nettles, Pamela Long, Dolly PartonAlyvia Alyn Lind, Ricky Schroder, Sam Haskell, Gerald McRaney, Hudson Hickman, Stephen Herek, Jennifer Nettles, Pamela Long, Dolly Parton See more', 'Initial release date': '2016-12-20', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.64 Ounces', 'Item model number': '43382116', 'Director': 'Stephen Herek', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, DVD', 'Run time': '1 hour and 25 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 20, 2016', 'Actors': 'Alyvia Alyn Lind, Jennifer Nettles, Ricky Schroder, Gerald McRaney', 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Producers': 'Hudson Hickman, Dolly Parton, Sam Haskell, Pamela Long', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Pamela Long', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Happy Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: On the Lord's Errand - Thomas S. Monson DVD Review Date: 2018/01/23 Store: Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Movies Product Description: ["On the Lord's Errand - Thomas S. Monson DVD"] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.3 x 0.6 inches; 0.71 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'DVD', 'Studio': 'The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints'} Review Text: Happy Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Labyrinth Review Date: 2021/08/11 Store: David Bowie (Actor), Jennifer Connelly (Actor), Jim Henson (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles Product Description: ["Relive the magic. This newly restored, 2-disc anniversary edition of Jim Henson's", 'Labyrinth', "contains an all-new commentary and bonus features that are guaranteed to captivate as never before. David Bowie and Jennifer Connelly invite you into a magical universe where nothing is what it seems. Babysitting infant stepbrother Toby on a weekend night isn't young Sarah's (Connelly) idea of fun. Frustrated by his crying, she secretly imagines the Goblins from her favorite book,", 'Labyrinth', ', carrying Toby away. When her fantasy comes true, a distraught Sarah must enter a maze of illusion to bring Toby back from a kingdom inhabited by mystical creatures and governed by the wicked Goblin King (Bowie).'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Sci-Fi, Fantasy, Children', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'David Bowie, Jim Henson, Toby Froud, Brian Henson, Eric Rattray, Labyrinth Enterprises, Shari Weiser, Christopher Malcolm, Jennifer Connelly, Natalie Finland, Ron Mueck, Shelley ThompsonDavid Bowie, Jim Henson, Toby Froud, Brian Henson, Eric Rattray, Labyrinth Enterprises, Shari Weiser, Christopher Malcolm, Jennifer Connelly, Natalie Finland, Ron Mueck, Shelley Thompson See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 41 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; At a crossroads after a divorce, Gilbert takes a year-long sabbatical from her job and steps uncharacteristically out of her comfort zone, risking everything to change her life. In her wondrous and exotic travels, she experiences the simple pleasure of nourishment by eating in Italy; the power of prayer in India, and, finally and unexpectedly, the inner peace and balance of love in Bali. Based on an inspiring true story,', 'Eat Pray Love', 'proves that there really is more than one way to let yourself go and see the world.', 'Amazon.com', "Elizabeth Gilbert's memoir of enlightenment gets the deluxe treatment at the hands of", 'Glee', 'creator Ryan Murphy, who bathes every scene in a golden glow. Unaccustomed to being alone, Liz (Julia Roberts) exits her marriage to Stephen (Billy Crudup, quite good) only to enter into an affair with an actor (James Franco, curiously uncomfortable), who introduces her to meditation. Just as her editor, Delia (', 'Doubt', "'s Viola Davis, making the most of a small role), longed to have a baby, Liz has longed to see the world. Delia persuades her to seize the day (plus, money presents no obstacle). First, she travels to Italy, where she noshes from Rome to Naples, making new friends along the way. Then, she heads to an ashram in India, where she meets a bride-to-be and a remorseful man (Richard Jenkins, heartbreaking), who nurture her altruistic side. Her sojourn ends in Bali, where she reunites with Ketut (Hadi Subiyanto, hilarious), the healer who first encouraged her to reassess her situation. While there, she befriends a single mother and a single father (", 'No Country for Old Men', "'s Javier Bardem) who falls for her charms. In an improvement over his version of", 'Running with Scissors', ", Murphy combines two Oscar winners, two Oscar nominees, and four countries to follow one woman's path to fulfillment. Like", 'Julie and Julia', 'and', 'How Stella Got Her Groove Back', ", Liz's story becomes more involving as she lets go of the superficial, but Murphy's movie still represents a triumph of escapism over spirituality.", '--Kathleen C. Based on this purchase history, summarize this person's genuine preferences and patterns in under 256 words. Focus only on keywords and clear trends supported by multiple interactions. Do not repeat specific product names or details. Here's the purchase data: === Purchase Information === Product Title: Sound of Music 50th Anniversary [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2016/06/03 Store: Julie Andrews (Actor), Christopher Plummer (Actor), Robert Wise (Director) & 0 more Rated: G Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Blu-ray Disc 1:', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 Feature Film Remastered in 1080p Hi-Def with 7.1 DTS-HD Sound', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 Your Favorite Things: An Interactive Celebration — All-New Immersive Viewing Experience with Behind-the-Scenes Images, On-Screen Lyrics, Trivia Track and Location Quiz', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 Music Machine Sing-Along', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 Audio Commentaries with Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Director Robert Wise', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Blu-ray Disc 2:', 'o\xa0\xa0\xa0 NEW hour-long documentary THE SOUND OF A CITY: JULIE ANDREWS RETURNS TO SALZBURG', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 NOTE: Digital subscription will work even if the codes are expired.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Musicals & Performing Arts/Musicals/General', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, Heather Menzies, Duane Chase, Robert Wise, Nicholas Hammond, Rodgers & Hammerstein, Charmian Carr, Eleanor Parker, Peggy Wood, Angela Cartwright, Richard HaydnJulie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, Heather Menzies, Duane Chase, Robert Wise, Nicholas Hammond, Rodgers & Hammerstein, Charmian Carr, Eleanor Parker, Peggy Wood, Angela Cartwright, Richard Haydn See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 56 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.5 x 5.3 x 6.7 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '24543029564', 'Director': 'Robert Wise', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 56 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 10, 2015', 'Actors': 'Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, Eleanor Parker, Richard Haydn, Peggy Wood', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English, French', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Happy Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Secret Garden (Hallmark Hall of Fame) Review Date: 2016/06/03 Store: Gennie James (Actor), Barret Oliver (Actor), Alan Grint (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family Product Description: ['Product description', "Well-loved TV adaptation of Frances Hodgson Burnett's novel.", 'Amazon.com', "Mary Lennox (Gennie James) is a spoiled young British girl orphaned by an Indian epidemic. She is sent to Misselthwaite Manor in Yorkshire to live with a distant relative, Archibald Craven (Derek Jacobi), and there she becomes obsessed with a secret, overgrown garden. With the help of a local boy, Dickon, the garden and everyone around them--including Craven and his frail son, Colin--come to life again. Filmed on location at scenic Highclere Castle in Newbury, this Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation of Frances Hodgson Burnett's classic won an Emmy for Outstanding Children's Program. Although it can't top the 1949 version with Margaret O'Brien (or Agnieszka Holland's 1993 version), younger viewers may prefer this more straightforward retelling, whereas adults are sure to appreciate the fine performances by Jacobi and Billie Whitelaw (Mrs. Medlock). Colin Firth (", "Bridget Jones's Diary", ') appears briefly as the adult Colin in this timeless, uplifting story for all ages.', '--Kathleen C. Fennessy'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Dolby, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Philip Locke, Alan Grint, Frances Hodgson Burnett, Colin Firth, Cassie Stuart, Barret Oliver, Karen Archer, Julian Glover, Billie Whitelaw, Jadrien Steele, Gennie James, Michael Hordern, Derek Jacobi, Lucy Gutteridge, Blanche HanalisPhilip Locke, Alan Grint, Frances Hodgson Burnett, Colin Firth, Cassie Stuart, Barret Oliver, Karen Archer, Julian Glover, Billie Whitelaw, Jadrien Steele, Gennie James, Michael Hordern, Derek Jacobi, Lucy Gutteridge, Blanche Hanalis See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Alan Grint', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 21, 2002', 'Actors': 'Gennie James, Barret Oliver, Jadrien Steele, Michael Hordern, Billie Whitelaw', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Hallmark', 'Writers': 'Blanche Hanalis, Frances Hodgson Burnett', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Happy Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Eat Pray Love (Theatrical and Extended Cut) [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2016/10/15 Store: Julia Roberts (Actor), James Franco (Actor), Ryan Murphy (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Liz Gilbert (Julia Roberts) is a modern woman on a quest to marvel at and travel the world while rediscovering and reconnecting with her true inner self in', 'Eat Pray Love', '. At a crossroads after a divorce, Gilbert takes a year-long sabbatical from her job and steps uncharacteristically out of her comfort zone, risking everything to change her life. In her wondrous and exotic travels, she experiences the simple pleasure of nourishment by eating in Italy; the power of prayer in India, and, finally and unexpectedly, the inner peace and balance of love in Bali. Based on an inspiring true story,', 'Eat Pray Love', 'proves that there really is more than one way to let yourself go and see the world.', 'Amazon.com', "Elizabeth Gilbert's memoir of enlightenment gets the deluxe treatment at the hands of", 'Glee', 'creator Ryan Murphy, who bathes every scene in a golden glow. Unaccustomed to being alone, Liz (Julia Roberts) exits her marriage to Stephen (Billy Crudup, quite good) only to enter into an affair with an actor (James Franco, curiously uncomfortable), who introduces her to meditation. Just as her editor, Delia (', 'Doubt', "'s Viola Davis, making the most of a small role), longed to have a baby, Liz has longed to see the world. Delia persuades her to seize the day (plus, money presents no obstacle). First, she travels to Italy, where she noshes from Rome to Naples, making new friends along the way. Then, she heads to an ashram in India, where she meets a bride-to-be and a remorseful man (Richard Jenkins, heartbreaking), who nurture her altruistic side. Her sojourn ends in Bali, where she reunites with Ketut (Hadi Subiyanto, hilarious), the healer who first encouraged her to reassess her situation. While there, she befriends a single mother and a single father (", 'No Country for Old Men', "'s Javier Bardem) who falls for her charms. In an improvement over his version of", 'Running with Scissors', ", Murphy combines two Oscar winners, two Oscar nominees, and four countries to follow one woman's path to fulfillment. Like", 'Julie and Julia', 'and', 'How Stella Got Her Groove Back', ", Liz's story becomes more involving as she lets go of the superficial, but Murphy's movie still represents a triumph of escapism over spirituality.", '--Kathleen C. Fennessy'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Romance', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Javier Bardem, Julia Roberts, Viola Davis, Richard Jenkins, Ryan Murphy, Billy Crudup, James Franco', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '4 hours and 45 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.51 x 5.43 x 6.8 inches; 5.92 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '15059349', 'Director': 'Ryan Murphy', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '4 hours and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 23, 2010', 'Actors': 'Julia Roberts, James Franco, Richard Jenkins, Viola Davis, Billy Crudup', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: No movie cover. Review Title: Three Stars Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Greater Review Date: 2017/01/05 Store: Neal McDonough (Actor), Quinton Aaron (Actor), David Hunt (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['Product Description', 'GREATER follows the true story of Brandon Burlsworth who is perhaps the greatest walk-on in the history of college football. Brandon dreamed of playing for the Arkansas Razorbacks but was told he wasn t good enough to play Division I ball. Undeterred, Brandon took a risk and walked on in 1994. Written off by fellow teammates and coaches, Brandon displayed dogged determination in the face of staggering odds. The awkward kid who once was an embarrassment to his teammates and an annoyance to his coaches ended up becoming the most respected player in the history of the program, changing the lives of all he touched.', 'Review', '"Burlsworth s story is undeniably touching"- --LA times"The best underdog sports movies since The Blind Side. It will make you stand up and cheer!" --NYC movie guru"Greater is a tremendous and inspiring film" --Dove'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '8 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 7.05 Ounces', 'Item model number': '43297414', 'Director': 'David Hunt', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, THX', 'Run time': '2 hours and 10 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 20, 2016', 'Actors': 'Neal McDonough, Quinton Aaron, Christopher Severio', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Well Go Usa', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Love it. **Summary of Preferences and Patterns:**

1. **Entertainment Genre**: Strong preference for musicals, romantic dramas, and family films, indicating a love for emotional storytelling and uplifting narratives.
  
2. **Media Format**: Consistent purchase of Blu-ray and DVD formats, suggesting a commitment to physical media and high-quality viewing experiences.

3. **Content Engagement**:
   - High ratings (4.6 to 5.0) across purchases indicate satisfaction with selected titles.
   - Frequent positive sentiment is shown in review texts (e.g., "Happy," "Love it," "Funny movie"), signifying emotional connection and enjoyment from viewing experiences.

4. **Cultural Interest**: Purchases show a mix of classic and contemporary themes, highlighting a blend of nostalgia with a passion for personal growth and stories with deeper meanings (e.g., journeys of self-discovery).

5. **Documentary & Biographical Themes**: Inclusive interest in documentaries and biographical films, pointing towards appreciation for real-life stories and inspirational figures.

6. **Seasonal Preferences**: Purchasing holiday-themed content reflects an affinity for seasonal enjoyment and family-oriented celebrations.

7. **Actors & Directors**: Favorable engagement with specific actors and directors suggests a loyalty towards their work, particularly those known for heartfelt and engaging storytelling.

Overall, the individual exhibits a clear preference for emotionally resonant content, high production values, and physical media, engaging deeply with the films they choose.

target_interaction.title: Great movie
target_interaction.text: It represented PTSD really well in humans and dogs. It was a fun, hilarious, and heart warming movie. I highly recommend this movie but be careful young children it may not be suitable for.
